sentences.english: Hu Xuebing can use gypsum as skillfully as his ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 胡學兵對於石膏的純熟運用和他的祖先如出一轍。

sentences.english: Practice skillfully and there are benefits to improve the ability of the actual combat.
sentences.chinese: 習之純熟，對於演練實戰技能，頗有益處。

sentences.english: Good kiting skills are essential for a good launch technique.
sentences.chinese: 純熟的頂傘技巧對良好起飛技術而言是有必要的。

sentences.english: The diversity and skilled band will make you unforgettable.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊表演的多樣性及純熟定會令你難以忘懷。

sentences.english: Mr. Lin is a dexterous surgeon.
sentences.chinese: 林先生是位技術純熟的外科醫師。

sentences.english: I ever asked him, if other people could learn such skillful operation.
sentences.chinese: 我曾問他，如此純熟的操舟技術，是否能學得來。

sentences.english: The band will make you unforgettable.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊表演的純熟定會令你難以忘懷。

sentences.english: I am a good annualant and have a absolute knowledge of the English accent.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個優良的會計員，同時堅信對英文頗爲純熟。

definition: lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
